articles.author: Sruthi Shankar
articles.title: US STOCKS-Wall Street set to slide as Middle East tensions escalate
articles.description: U.S. stocks were set fall for a second straight session on Monday as escalating tensions between the United States and Iran prompted investors to seek refuge in safer assets such as gold and government bonds.
articles.content:
* Apple down after Needham downgrade 
* Energy stocks flat despite oil jump 
* Defense stocks rise premarket 
* Futures down: Dow 0.63%, S&P 0.56%, Nasdaq 0.69% (For a live blog on the U.S. stock market, click or type LIVE/ in a news window.)

articles.title: Pakistan won't take sides in Iran-U.S. confrontation - foreign minister
articles.description: Pakistan will not take sides in the escalating confrontation between neighbouring Iran and the United States, its foreign minister said on Monday, following the killing of Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani in a U.S. drone strike.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: ADM sells palm business in Brazil as part of portfolio overhaul
articles.description: Grain trader Archer Daniels Midland Co has sold its palm business in Brazil to local player Reflorestadora Moju Acará, according to the Brazilian antitrust watchdog Cade.
articles.content:
SAO PAULO, Jan 6 (Reuters) - Grain trader Archer Daniels Midland Co has sold its palm business in Brazil to local player Reflorestadora Moju Acará, according to the Brazilian antitrust watchdog Cade.

articles.title: Renault hires former PSA research chief
articles.description: French car marker Renault said has hired former PSA research and development chief Gilles Le Borgne as head of engineering.
articles.content:
PARIS (Reuters) - French car marker Renault (RENA.PA) said has hired former PSA (PEUP.PA) research and development chief Gilles Le Borgne as head of engineering.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Djokovic, Nadal march on with convincing wins at ATP Cup
articles.description: Novak Djokovic braved extreme humidity to overcome tricky opponent Gael Monfils 6-3 6-2 at the inaugural ATP Cup team event in Brisbane on Monday.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Novak Djokovic braved extreme humidity to overcome tricky opponent Gael Monfils 6-3 6-2 at the inaugural ATP Cup team event in Brisbane on Monday. 
World number one Rafael Nadal was also in a punishing mood and kept his preparations for th… [+2752 chars]

articles.title: Natura & Co lifts cost-saving synergy estimate after closing of Avon deal
articles.description: Brazil cosmetics group Natura & Co has raised its estimates for annual cost-savings stemming from the combination with Avon Products , but is still calculating potential revenue synergies, executives said on Monday.
articles.content: SAO PAULO (Reuters) - Brazil cosmetics group Natura & Co (NTCO3.SA) has raised its estimates for annual cost-savings stemming from the combination with Avon Products AVP.N, but is still calculating potential revenue synergies, executives said on Monday. … [+501 chars]

articles.title: British PM, Iraqi PM agree on need to de-escalate regional tensions: UK statement
articles.description: Britain's Prime Minister Boris Johnson agreed with Iraq's Prime Minister Adel Abdul Mahdi on the need to de-escalate tensions in the region when they spoke by phone on Monday, according to a UK statement.
articles.content:

articles.author: Duncan Miriri and Katharine Houreld
articles.title: Kenya arrests three men for trying to breach British army camp
articles.description: Kenyan police arrested three men suspected of trying to break into a British army camp in Laikipia in central Kenya on the same day Islamist insurgents attacked another base used by U.S. and Kenyan forces, according to a police report seen by Reuters.

articles.title: Bangladesh to ban use of single-use plastic in hotels and restaurants
articles.description: Bangladesh's High Court on Monday ordered the government to ban single-use plastics in coastal areas and in hotels and restaurants in one year to combat pollution.
articles.content:
DHAKA (Reuters) - Bangladesh’s High Court on Monday ordered the government to ban single-use plastics in coastal areas and in hotels and restaurants in one year to combat pollution.

articles.title: Ford U.S. sales fall 1.3% in fourth quarter
articles.description: Ford Motor Co reported a 1.3% fall in sales for the fourth quarter in the United States, hurt by declining sales of passenger cars.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Ford Motor Co (F.N) reported a 1.3% fall in sales for the fourth quarter in the United States, hurt by declining sales of passenger cars.
